title: Four arrested in Payne Springs drug bust
content: Four people were arrested for drug crimes in a Payne Springs home Friday just after 4 p.m., according to the Henderson County Sheriff’s office.    A narcotics search warrant was issued by Henderson County Court at Law, Judge Scott Williams for 156 Huntoon Trail in the Cherokee Shores subdivision of Payne Springs.    During the search, Jimmy Dale was discovered with 20 grams of suspected methamphetamines, jn addition to numerous baggies and scales.         Dale was arrested for manufacture or delivery of a controlled substance in penalty group 1 which is a first degree felony.    Kendra Ward, Jesse Tobar and Debbie Beasley were also arrested for possessing suspected methamphetamines. They were charged with possession of a controlled substance in penalty group 1 which is a state jail felony.                   They transported to the Henderson County Jail. Dale is being held on a $10,000 bond, Ward’s is $8,500, Tobar’s is is $8,500 and Beasley’s is also $8,500.    © 2018 KYTX
